intro: Prenanthes cylindricus, commonly known as the slender burrweed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Araceae family and is characterized by its narrow, cylindrical spathes that enclose the spadix. The plant typically grows in wetland habitats, such as marshes and along the edges of ponds. Its small, greenish-white flowers are clustered on the spadix, and it produces berries that are often used as food by wildlife. Prenanthes cylindricus is often found in moist, sunny environments and is a common sight in prairie and wetland ecosystems.
